ALPINE.Definition: relating to the Alps (the mountain range)

BACKGROUND.Definition: the set of conditions that existed before a particular event, or information about them which helps to explain the event

BIASED.Definition: preferring or disliking someone or something more than someone or something else, in a way that means that they are treated unfairly

BROADCAST.Definition: to send out a programme on television or radio

CIRCULATION.Definition: the number of people that a newspaper or magazine is regularly sold to

CONVINCE.Definition: to persuade someone or make someone certain

DATE BACK.Definition: to have existed for a particular length of time or since a particular time

DECLARING.Definition: to announce something clearly, firmly, publicly, or officially

ERA.Definition: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

EXOTIC.Definition: unusual and exciting because of coming (or seeming to come) from far away, especially a tropical country

FUNCTIONALITY.Definition: any or all of the operations performed by a piece of equipment or a software program

FUNERAL.Definition: a (usually religious) ceremony for burying or burning the body of a dead person

GRAVITY.Definition: the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground

HARVEST.Definition: the crops that have been gathered

HIGHBROW.Definition: (of books, plays, etc.) involving serious and complicated or artistic ideas, or (of people) interested in serious and complicated subjects

INCREASINGLY.Definition: to (make something) become larger in amount or size

INTRAVENOUS.Definition: into or connected to a vein

KEEN.Definition: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much

LOWBROW.Definition: (of entertainment) not complicated or demanding much intelligence to be understood

MASS MEDIA.Definition: newspapers, television, radio, and the internet

MINION.Definition: a main character from the Despicable Me series

ORIGINS.Definition: the beginning or cause of something

PINT.Definition: a measure for liquid equal to about half a litre, used as a typical measure for beer

POP CULTURE.Definition: music, TV, cinema, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

PRACTICAL JOKES.Definition: a joke that makes someone seem silly and involves a physical action rather than words

PRANK.Definition: a trick that is intended to be funny but not to cause harm or damage

PRESCRIPTION.Definition: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs

PROVED.Definition: to show a particular result after a period of time

REFLECT.Definition: to show, express, or be a sign of something

RIDICULOUS.Definition: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at

SHAME.Definition: If something is described as a shame, it is disappointing or not satisfactory

SO-CALLED.Definition: used to show that you think a word that is used to describe someone or something is not suitable or not correct

SPOILS.Definition: destroys or reduces the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something

TRICKING.Definition: an action that is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment

TUBE.Definition: a long, hollow cylinder of plastic, metal, rubber, or glass, used for moving or containing liquids or gases

UNIQUE.Definition: being the only existing one of its type or, more generally, unusual, or special in some way
